intro: Drimys granadensis var. granadensis, commonly known as the Granada drimys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, cool environments such as cloud forests. The plant has dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth margin. Its flowers are small, white or pale green, and are arranged in clusters, often emitting a subtle fragrance. The fruit is a small, dark blue berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
